instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PP1V8_S5: What is PP1V8_S5? PP1V8_S5 is a 1.8v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Have two board with exactly same issue. stack at 5V and 0.10Amps. No water damage, no previous problem. 

I was checking other topics. Seems that some of this models with T2 may be firmware issue. So i can see that there is a way to restore it for MBP 2018 but cant find same for MBA 2019.  Anyone can help me?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Do you get any voltages on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Yes:
PBUS , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> 12,3V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>-5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> - 0V (<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> -0V) and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> also 0. is that ok?
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 3.2V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.2V




<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> -0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Looks like T2 firmware corruption.
No S5 voltage comes on usually.

Compare your values with these:
"<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> SYM 1 of 4:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL> = 3.37V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 1.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> = 3.37V
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> = 3.0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> = 1.2V
<SIGNAL>CPU_C10_GATE_L</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>LDO_RTC</SIGNAL> = 1.5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL> = 3.37V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL> = 3.37V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V"
extracted from this thread
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/55802-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-stuck-at-5v[/url]

threads.message: Yes seems to be t2 corruption. Anything to do with this shit board or throw it away? Is there any way to restore this firmware like mbp but for mba?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
I think someone reported that not any cable serves.
Maybe 12" machine doesn't serve, or the cable is not compatible.
Also be sure to find the correct USB-C port for DFU recovery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: there is no way to put this fu...ing machine in dFU mode like apple's site instruction tell us. also using apple official thunderbolt it says that it's not compatible. Anyone had succes with mba 2018-2019???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
I have had success using apples USB-C charging cable only on the 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP. I tried the same cable on two different 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'s and got the same error you are getting about "Cannot Use Thunderbolt accessory". I ended up having to buy apple's Thunderbolt 3 cable (With the lightning bolt symbol on the connectors) and then I was able to get both of my <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'s into DFU mode. [URL="https://www.apple.com/shop/product/MQ4H2AM/A/thunderbolt-3-usb%E2%80%91c-cable-08-m"]https://www.apple.com/shop/product/M...91c-cable-08-m[/URL] 

Also, apple's instructions says to hold the keys for 3 seconds but I found that holding them for 7 seconds works better.
